Global Talent Acquisition Specialist

Various
Americas Time Zones
Company: Percona
Full Time

Overview

Percona is a leader in providing best-of-breed enterprise-class support, consulting, managed services, training and software for MySQL®, MariaDB®, MongoDB®, PostgreSQL® and other open source databases in on-premises and cloud environments. Our services and software accommodate rapid growth and application development, help companies develop and deploy agile solutions and improve your ability to keep up with customer needs.

Percona open source database expertise helps businesses avoid downtime and outages, meet customer experience expectations, foster operational and developer collaboration and manage enterprise risks through sound database architecture frameworks.

Discover what it means to work with some of the smartest people in the industry, and help solve some of the most challenging customer problems. We offer flexible hours, competitive salaries, the ability to work remote and the amazing experience of working with a multinational team of experts.

Description

This is role is for a high energy recruiter who brings lots of enthusiasm to recruitment on a data driven best practices basis.  Are you a Talent Acquisition Specialist that enjoys working with candidates around the world and whose focus is creating a positive and unique candidate experience while working closely with internal stakeholders?  If so, keep reading, because we have the right career opportunity for you.

Key Outcome: Timely Recruitment of High Skilled Talent
  • Work with Percona Hiring Managers to source and close A-player candidates for key roles.
  • All roles will primarily be remote work from home.
  • Operating hours are flexible due to potential candidates being across worldwide time zones.

    • Key Outcome: Be Data Driven and Use Metrics in decision making
    • The right candidate will be data driven including reporting metrics of “Time to Hire”, “% Organic Referral”, “% Passive Candidate” “Recruitment Cost/Hire”.
    • Metrics will drive a referrals based recruitment practice including from internal personnel, former staff, industry contacts, and other candidates.
    • Regularly work with hiring teams for weekly postings of coolest job openings as well as staying in contact with past and new referral sources (keep a very active and rich ATS).

      • Key Outcome: External Percona Branding
      • Serving as the first point of contact for candidates to experience and promote Percona culture.
      • Work with internal teams to make sure our external face (digital, community conference, highly read Percona blog, etc) attracts high quality candidates to our roles.

        • Key Effort: Interviewer Development
        • You will be a primary stakeholder in training and helping hiring managers and other interviewers do best practices in interviewing to help make the best hires.

          • Key Effort: System Administration
          • You will be our primary system administrator for our Lever Applicant Tracking System (ATS) and own our LinkedIn recruitment relationship.
          • Reviewing resumes and conducting screening interviews.
          • Opening and closing requisitions.
          • Editing for accuracy & clarity the job descriptions that are written by hiring managers.
          • Work with Business Services, hiring manager and applicant to administer testing, if needed, and other screening best practices.
          • Coordinating between hiring manager, candidate, and HR to schedule and facilitate interview process.

            • Tools We Utilize Include (but aren’t limited to):
            • LinkedIn Recruiter
            • Lever
            • BambooHR
            • Some Local Country Job Boards
            • Who: The A-Method For Hiring

              Preferred Skills & Abilities
              • Proven track record of successful recruiting program coordination (5-7 years experience)
              • Experience with Lever (ATS) and BambooHR (HRIS)
              • Experience working remotely and internationally
              • Knowledgeable of the Open Source industry or Open Source database technology
              • Experience with using Who: the A-Method of Hiring

                •   Remote / work from home opening with ability to work AMERs hours.

                Location:

                Remote work from home openings require consistent and strong internet access.

                HQ is in Durham, NC USA.  Staff members should be available if there is a need for any onsite trainings and/or events at any time.

                Note that your legal agreement will be with Percona Staffing LLC, a USA corporation and a subsidiary of Percona LLC.

People Operations Coordinator – HR Coordinator at Protocol Labs

Remote | Freelance | International

REMOTE

OPERATIONS PEOPLE

CONTRACT-TO-HIRE

We seek a detailed oriented and passionate People Ops Coordinator who is self-driven, independent and motivated to build efficient systems and processes.

People at Protocol Labs

The People Team at Protocol Labs powers our work. Protocol Labs is a product-development lab, but behind the protocols and tools we build, behind the research and spec work, behind our implementations are passionate people, teammates and community members. The people team ensures that the Protocol Labs team remains happy, aligned and productive. Protocol Labs works at the intersection of many exciting fields (crypto, networks, distributed systems) and cultures (startups, research, open source, distributed work). The people team has the challenging and exciting task of taking the best from these cultures to shape the way we work at PL and ensure we all grow as people and professionals. All of this happens in an environment defined by curiosity, passion, and a love for open source.

Responsibilities

  • Champion and facilitate an amazing employee experience at all touch-points of the employee lifecycle
  • Manage our HRIS ensuring it’s up-to-date, providing ad hoc reports extracting data from HR systems and processing new hires and any changes in the system
  • Respond to employee questions regarding policies and procedures
  • Respond to requests for employment verification
  • Help facilitate all visa processes
  • Support and help with ad hoc projects and requests
  • Assist with new hire activities including disseminating new hire documents to appropriate parties, requesting IT access, setting up profiles in HRIS, etc.
  • Constantly look for ways to automate and improve processes
  • Administer offboarding process and internal transfers by supporting HRBPs

Requirements

  • 1+ years of experience as an HR Coordinator or a similar role
  • Detail-oriented with impeccable follow through
  • Experience in startup culture – comfortable with ambiguity and non-stop problem solving, building, and action
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

What’s it like to work at Protocol Labs?

Protocol Labs mission is to improve humanity’s most important technology, the Internet. We build protocols, systems, and tools to improve how it works. Today, we are focused on how we store, locate, and move information. Our projects include IPFS, Filecoin, libp2p, and more.

As a distributed team, we hire anywhere in the world, and at various levels of experience (entry, senior, staff). We look for people with unique perspectives and diverse backgrounds.

We have a great benefits package, including parental leave, contributions to your retirement, competitive pay, and unlimited time off. For U.S.-based employees, we also provide platinum-level health, dental, and vision coverage for you and your family.

International HR Executive (Startup Remote Work for Early Career)

Looking to join a company where you can make an impact? Are you looking for flexibility in your career and craving creative freedom?

This role is perfect for you, if you're looking for opportunities to grow and be part of a growing global team.

Shield GEO provides outsourced employment and payroll in over 90 countries. You will be supporting our team of global mobility consultants in the ongoing management of our GEO employees based all over the world. Your role is to help them in delivering great customer service.

This is an administration heavy role. You will have plenty of support from our operational teams, systems and technology platform.

You will have the opportunity to work remotely and with flexible hours. We are happy to support you if you’d like to travel while working with us, but expect you to have completed your training before commencing your travel plans. You’ll also have the opportunity to advance your career in a young, growing company.

Your background

  • A degree in HR, International Business, Finance or Law is preferred
  • You will need to be a recent university graduate to be considered for this role
Working with Shield

If the thought of being part of a young company with opportunities to create and ideate excite you, you’re at the right place. This is a chance for you to get into the International HR and Global Mobility industry.

We’re a remote-friendly company with employees all around the world. We don’t want to be limited by location and are open to hiring anyone from anywhere – as long as it’s a great fit for us both.

Every person is unique. At Shield GEO, we encourage an inclusive culture that embraces each individual’s differences. We believe that diversity of thought is vital to generating creative ideas, developing effective strategies and making better decisions.

When hiring we do not discriminate by any unlawful means including, but not limited to, race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.

We offer reasonable accommodations for people with disabilities wherever possible. Our employees are provided with the basic equipment required to give them a comfortable, safe and productive workplace. If you require additional equipment beyond our standard offering we are happy to work with you to try to find a solution.

Before we get to know you, you might like to get an idea of who we are so you can decide if you want to be a part of what we’re about.

We can’t quite show you what it’s like to work with us but you can hear from our employees themselves. Here’re some articles written by our Co-Founder,Customer Success Manager and Digital Marketing Manager.

  • Working remotely and flexibly with Shield Geo
  • Leave policy
  • Work equipment policy
  • Workplace Diversity policy

Do you fit our culture?

We think these are the most important characteristics for all Shield GEO employees. Is this you?

  • You love to get things done and you especially like solving problems.
  • You have empathy with your customers and partners
  • You are well organized with an eye for detail. Please keep your cover letter under 250 words and highlight one achievement you're most proud of.
  • You’re self-motivated. You’ll be reporting to someone in another time-zone and be comfortable being judged on your results.
  • You are clear, detailed and thoughtful in expressing yourself whether you’re on the phone, sending an email or making notes on a case. We are a mostly remote company interacting with a broad range of people located all over the world. Clear and detailed communication is essential in this environment. When dealing with external parties, you will need to ask questions and provide answers in ways that anyone can understand. Your written notes in our internal systems must make your work and decisions easy for others to follow.
  • You use analytical skills to understand the root cause of a problem.
  • You are decisive but also open to feedback if something isn’t working.
  • You are persistent. If you run into a roadblock you will try another approach.
  • You keep an eye on the big picture so you can identify longer term improvements to processes and systems. You try to get a little better every day and understand the long term benefits gained by creating reliable processes and systems.
  • You love helping people and pride yourself on your interaction with customers / business units.
Essential Characteristics of this role

  • You are very well organised and resourceful, including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills while coordinating with an international team
  • You are extremely self-disciplined and able to prioritise your work efficiently
  • Takes initiative, outcome focused
Responsibilities

You will be working very closely with an account manager as part of the global mobility team, this requires you to be in EU/East Coast USA time zones. Most of us work remotely and communicate via video communication tools. You should therefore also have excellent internet communication.

CASES

  • Create cases
  • Update our CRM platforms with latest status on cases
  • Monitor progress of cases raised by account managers (AMs) and alert/request action from Subject Matter Experts if a case has been left unattended for too long
INVOICING

  • Send input requests from AM account
  • Update our communication platforms with client responses and add inputs to the checklist as per AM's instructions
  • Compile AM emails for clients who do respond to inputs by deadline to inform them we are proceeding with no additional inputs
  • Send invoices from AM account
  • Create out of cycle (OOC) invoices as per AM instructions
  • Compile emails for AM to request for unpaid invoices
  • Update invoice status page
  • Ensure checklists are updated
Invoice Creation – Verification

  • Support Account Manager in inputting monthly invoicing figures in Salesforce for the required clients
  • Check the relevant invoicing card checklist item has been updated
  • Ensure the expense reports are saved with the right naming convention and in the relevant folder created on Salesforce
Sending Invoices

  • Support the Account Manager in sending out all payroll and OOC invoices
  • Ensure Salesforce invoice card is updated with the actions completed
  • Prepare follow up email templates for the AMs to send to clients
PAYSLIPS

  • Send payslips to employees who've requested a PDF copy
  • Update checklists with progress of process diligently
  • Inform the client and the employees on a monthly basis when payslips have been uploaded into Salesforce Dropbox
RENEWALS FOR EMPLOYMENT CONTRACTS (EC) AND WORK PERMITS (WP)

  • Create EC/WP expiry emails to client on behalf of your AM, and update our CRM platform accordingly
  • Create case for tracking purposes
  • Request local partners to proceed with renewal
  • Save renewal docs once finalised
  • Update Salesforce platform with new dates for EC and WP

Talent Acquisition Specialist at Trafilea

Remote | International

Remote Job

Description

At Trafilea, we are looking for a Senior Recruiter with excellent written and oral English and Spanish skills to join our REMOTE FULL TIME team.

It’s an excellent opportunity for those who want to work in a fast paced and dynamic team, learn about new and innovative tools and keep developing valuable skills within the talent acquisition/recruitment field.

ABOUT THE COMPANY

We’re a Data-Driven fast growing global e-commerce company. We create and expand brands worldwide, laser focused in performance marketing and online direct response strategies. For us it is key to excel in everything that we do, and this starts with the people that we hire.

We have an international team hand selected from 4 continents and we are looking for a strong, hands-on leader to join us as Growth hacker to help us keep on changing people’s lives while growing the company exponentially.

The ideal candidate possesses the following qualities:

  • HUNGRY: we’re a startup, there’s HUGE potential for the right candidate.
  • INDEPENDENT: we’re not here to micromanage
  • PASSIONATE: you love what you do and you’re a lifelong learner

If this sounds like you, we need to talk. We are looking forward to meeting you.

Requirements

ABOUT THE ROLE

What a typical day will look like?

  • You will be working for a highly dynamic and fast paced company that embraces agile technologies.
  • You can work from anywhere.
  • You will be recruiting and selecting talent from technological companies worldwide for different areas in the company, such as Digital Marketing, IT, Business Intelligence, Operations, Research, and HR.
  • You will be working closely with area managers worldwide and partnering up with them to create and implement creative sourcing strategies to attract the right talent for the areas already mentioned. Once the strategy is set, you will be involved in the whole recruiting process, including job posting, passive search, interviewing, coordinating background and reference checking process.
  • You will be proactively building a talent pipeline for current and future staffing needs.
  • You will have daily and weekly meetings with your team where you will be discussing updates, sharing learnings and brainstorming on process improvements.
  • You will be creating and sharing weekly, monthly and quarterly reports to send status updates.
  • You will be collaborating across the business to develop a consistently strong candidate experience that represents our corporate values.

REQUIREMENTS

In order to take this challenge you will need to have the following in your artillery:

  • At least 5 years of talent acquisition/recruitment experience within fast paced and dynamic companies (preferably, technology, marketing or online companies).
  • Strong English and Spanish skills, both written and spoken (This is a mandatory requirement).
  • Highly analytical and results driven.
  • Full time availability (40+ hours per week – UYT).
  • Now, let’s talk about the benefits of working with us.

Live Where You Want: As a global distributed team, you can live and work wherever you want. Take Vacation (Seriously) Yes, we’re growing and need your undivided attention, but we encourage you to take a vacation! It’s important to get out and do something.

Up Your Game: We love to see our people growing fast. We budget for it! Think courses, conferences, events… it’s really up to you and your manager.

What to Expect: Although there is flexibility on the work schedule, you would usually need to be available Monday to Friday from 9am to 6pm (Uruguay, Montevideo – Time Zone)

Recruiter at Close.io

Remote | International

NORTH AMERICA

OPERATIONS

FULL-TIME

About Us

At Close, we’re building the sales communication platform of the future. With our roots as the very first sales CRM to include built-in calling, we’re leading the industry toward eliminating manual processes and helping companies to close more deals (faster).

Since our founding in 2013, we’ve grown to become a profitable, 100% globally distributed team of 39 high-performing, happy people that are dedicated to building a product our customers love. In order to continually meet our hiring goals, we need a full time dedicated recruiter to join the team.

About You

We’re hiring our first in-house Recruiter to take Close talent management efforts to the next level while serving the incredible team we already have! (80% Recruiting / 20% Retention). As an ambassador of Close, you’ll be representing our team, culture, and brand. You should have a commitment to integrity, friendly-strength, and team building.

You have a proven track record of successfully recruiting for a remote, SaaS or tech company. You’re someone that showcases a high level of discernment, exceptional attention to detail with strong follow-up and follow-through.

You are comfortable working remotely as part of a small team, with a high level of autonomy. You can devise your own schedule and effectively manage your workload based on the biggest opportunities and company objectives.

As Close’s Recruiter you will be the main point of contact for all candidates and team members involved in recruiting and therefore anticipating needs on both sides is a critical part of this role. You’ll report directly to the Director of People Ops, Mary Hartberg and work closely with all hiring Managers at Close.

About The Role

Attracting top talent for Close is a recruiter’s dream. Our most recent team insights survey rated satisfaction of working at Close 9 out of 10 Our organization is committed to providing a healthy and diverse work environment – read more in our Guide To Us and Glassdoor reviews.

Requirements

  • Proficiency with an ATS (Greenhouse or Lever preferred)
  • Exceptional written and spoken English
  • Successful experience sourcing candidates, running outbound campaigns and using matching sites
  • Successful experience creating, implementing and conducting interviews
  • Solid understanding of HR practices and labor laws

Key Responsibilities

  • Work with hiring managers to create job descriptions, interview processes, and success metrics
  • Anticipate the needs of candidates and hiring team
  • Promote, track and manage all active positions
  • Develop and track meaningful KPIs
  • Work with marketing and people ops on company branding and awareness
  • Develop and implement a solid strategy for sourcing high-quality candidates and outbound campaigns
  • Develop and curate relationships with recruiting agencies and matching sites
  • Organize and host live recruiting events and attend relevant conferences
  • Create partnerships to attract top talent
  • Develop training for hiring teams
  • Work closely with people ops to ensure a smooth onboarding process for all new hires
  • Help develop internal programs and initiatives for retention and professional growth
  • Be willing and available to help people ops team when needed (as a growing organization, we’re still wearing many hats )

Why Close?

At Close, everyone has a voice. We encourage transparency and practicing a mature approach to the work-place. In general, we don’t have strict policies, we have guidelines. Work/Life harmony is an important part of our organization – we believe you bring your best to work when you practice self-care (whatever that looks like for you).

We come from 13 countries and 16 states; a collection of talented humans rich in diverse backgrounds, lifestyles, and cultures. Twice a year we meet up somewhere around the world to spend time with one another. We see these retreats as an opportunity to strengthen the social fiber of our community.

This team is growing in more ways than one – we’ve recently launched 10 babies (and counting!). Unanimously, our favorite and most impactful value is “Build a house you want to live in.” We strive to make decisions that are authentic for our organization. At Close, we have a high care factor for one another, in making an awesome product and championing the success of our customers.

  • 100% remote (we believe in trust and autonomy)
  • 2 x annual team retreats (Lisbon Retreat Video)
  • Competitive salary
  • 7 weeks PTO (includes company-wide winter holiday break)
  • 1 month paid sabbatical after 5 years
  • $200/month co-working stipend
  • Paid parental leave (10 wks primary caregiver / 4 wks secondary caregiver)
  • 99% premiums paid for excellent medical and dental coverage, including an HSA option (US residents)
  • 401k matching at 4% (US residents)
  • Dependent care FSA (US residents)
  • Our story and team
  • Glassdoor Reviews

At Close, we're building the sales communication platform of the future. With our roots as the very first sales CRM to include built-in calling, we're leading the industry toward eliminating manual processes and helping companies to close more deals (faster).

Attracting top talent for Close is a recruiter’s dream. Our most recent team insights survey rated satisfaction of working at Close 9 out of 10 Our organization is committed to providing a healthy and diverse work environment - read more in our Guide To Us and Glassdoor reviews.

Description

Do you have in-depth knowledge of contemporary romance? Are you eager to put that expertise to good use and earn a consistent income?

If so, then this could very well be your next paid writing gig!

 

* Job Overview

We are currently looking to expand our fiction team with amazing and experienced contemporary romance writers. Please note, this role is looking for those with ample experience within contemporary romance, those without solid experience won’t qualify. Also, please be aware that writers must be US/Canada based. Exceptions can be made if you’re a brilliant writer from a native English speaking country.

We are a fast-paced, growing ghostwriting service that can provide you with consistent and exciting projects week after week! We offer consistent work without having to apply for jobs, with the work coming to you.

If you are someone that takes pride in their work and is looking to earn a regular income doing what you love, while also working from the comfort of your home or office, then you may be in luck!

 

* The Company

As a company, our brand is synonymous with the highest quality of writing and great customer experience. Our online reviews are a testament to that. We are thrilled about this and continue to strive for more.

However, our focus isn't just on our clients, but also on the team that helps make this happen. We love our team and are dedicated to creating an enjoyable work environment. Our working relationship ensures we can keep their calendars full of exciting projects whilst providing them with a steady income.

In return, our writers make sure that every client receives an outstanding experience from start to finish. As a collective, we're always looking for ways to improve our process. Our commitment to quality is an aspect of our brand we're always looking to improve, and is part of the reason our company has continued to grow.

 

* Pay Rate

Our current rate is $15 USD per 1,000 words. Our projects range from 20k up to 150k words.

Our busier writers earn $2,000+ a month writing a few hours a day around their studies and other gigs. 

 

* Our Requirements

We're looking for contemporary romance writers with a good skill level, who are familiar with similar paced roles. Partnered with a good understanding of contemporary romance conventions, we also need writers who understand the intricacies of contemporary romance as well. 

 

* Desired Bonus Subgenres/Themes

Within contemporary romance, we currently have the most demand for writers that write contemporary romance stories with any of the following additional subgenres/themes hybrids:

  • Alpha male character
  • Bully romance
  • Billionaire romance
  • Paranormal

 

* Here's what's required to be part of our team

  • You write amazing romance stories. With a lot of tension, suspense, great dialogue, and good character development and characterization.
  • You are US/Canada based, or exceptional writer from a different native English country.
  • You can work with deadlines. We typically deliver 15k words in 1 week/ week and a half.
  • You are knowledgeable in contemporary romance themes/tropes. You understand the readers, you understand the conventions and you can write to market.
  • You take pride in your writing and can consistently deliver high-quality novels. You focus on delivering what the reader and client want.
  • You are looking for a long-term gig and are eager & available to start.
  • You are available throughout the day to respond to team and client messages on our platform.
  • You are reliable, well-spoken, open to constructive criticism and a good communicator.

 

* Few things to consider before applying

Important: Please submit relevant samples for contemporary romance and samples for any of the bonus subgenres/themes we mentioned above. If you’re successful, we’ll hire you based on your ability to write and your understanding of contemporary romance conventions. We put a lot of emphasis on this as it's vital to understand what the reader wants.

We’ll prioritize those who can commit to at least 3-6 months of work. This is because we love to establish long-term relationships with our team, and also because our clients love to create a series of projects with the same writer. 

Also, you must be able to sit down and write in order to meet deadlines. Good planning should make this easier. Again, availability throughout the day to respond to messages on our platform is essential.

Finally, you must fully understand what a ghostwriting position entails, and that no official credit will be given to you for the work completed.

 

* How To Apply?

If you're still interested, we're excited to hear from you! To apply, please click the below to complete our form; this will consist of multiple-choice questions, as well as somewhere to upload your writing samples. If you're a little unsure about your level of experience, you may wish to apply for our general romance fiction writers. This is a role that requires in-depth knowledge of contemporary romance, so if you feel you’re a good fit, we'd love to consider you :)

 

* Application Form

https://airtable.com/shrk4Ug4RngCp1fC3

Please remember to provide at least 2 samples, one of which conveys intimacy/a romantic moment between the characters. Each sample must be at least 1,000 words.

We get numerous applications on a daily basis, so please bear with us and allow at least 2 weeks for us to go through your application.

 

Best of luck!

Hotghostwriter.com

Cold Calling wizard for Sales Development Representative Role!

Overview

At Surprise HR, we’re committed to hiring driven people who light up with competitive glee from our team’s guiding principle: to derive a tremendous sense of purpose from the inner quest for excellence itself, being driven from within to make anything we touch be the best it can be.

We need high level cold calling SDRs to help book meetings for our world class account executives. This mainly includes a high volume of daily outbound cold calling to engage prospects.

Your primary purpose is to effectively engage with director-, vp-, and c-level executives and decision makers in order to get them interested enough to agree to a follow up call and meeting with our account executives.

You are the "first line" of the Surprise HR sales offensive, directly engaging with executives and setting our sales professionals up for success. You are responsible for filling their pipeline and ensuring they are constantly taking follow up calls and meetings. We have set up an intuitive and effective outbound sales engagement infrastructure and we need you to help drive it's success, fuel it's growth, and impact the company beyond measure. If this is a challenge that you would be very excited to undertake — read on.

Your Impact

As our Cold Calling SDR, and a member of the Surprise HR sales team, you will be responsible for achieving weekly targets in terms of the number of scheduled discovery calls with high-quality prospects for our sales team. This will require you to:
  • Make a required amount of daily prospect cold calls. Expect this to be in 400-500 range. We will provide an auto dialer and the majority of people won't pick up, hence the need for a high volume + cast a wide daily net. 
  • Handle a substantial amount of follow up emails / communications to prospects you've spoken to on the phone.
  • Utilize organizational, process, and technological strategies to improve meeting conversion.
  • Collaborate intensively with sales team executives and be accountable for a high quality pipeline.

You need to deliver "Sales Qualified Leads" only to our sales executives. To be clear, these prospects must exhibit the following in order to be "qualified":  


1) The prospect is a part of the decision making team.

2) The prospect has expressed a clear need for our platform.

3) The prospect has confirmed that the organization would be able to evaluate the program w/in the next 6 months.

4) The prospect has confirmed that the organization can afford to invest in the program.

... We will not accept any leads from you to the sales executives that do NOT fit this criteria, as it will be a waste of time for all stakeholders involved.


Requirements
  1. Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Communication, Marketing, or similar 
    1. Demonstrated academic achievement would be ideal (e.g. honors, Dean’s list, etc.) 
    2. Competitive athletics/sports or other extracurriculars would be ideal 
  2. 1-2 years experience in a high-volume, sales development role 
    1. At a high-growth technology company would be ideal (startups included) 
    2. Demonstrated experience handling high volume of cold calling. If you have NEVER successfully cold called, please do not apply. 
  3. Is comfortable and has hands-on software experience with: 
    1. Gmail/GSUITE 
    2. Salesforce, Ring Central and automatic dialing software 
  4. Excellent communicator + quick learner 
    1. Demonstrated ability to effectively articulate sales propositions over the phone and be a gifted question asker.
    2. Ability to absorb best practices and create winning emails that convert to confirmed meetings
    3. Amazing listener. Be able to listen to the prospects reactions/objections, address them effectively and get them interested in further sales conversations + meetings. 
  5. Career-focused and wanting to work hard in an impact-heavy role
  6. Incredible attention to detail and high level of reliability
  7. Ability to overcome problems and create spontaneous, working solutions.
  8. Incredibly reliable and always on time. This is critical; there's zero room or tolerance for unreliable people or people that have a tendency to go "MIA" during business hours. You must always be by your phone/computer and locked in + ready to make calls.
  9. Will be expected to be making calls from 9am-5pm EST, Monday-Friday.
  10. Must be highly effective autonomous worker. Although we have a robust communication and support system, this is a purely remote role, so you need to be able to work well on your own. 
  11. You must have a working computer (can be PC or Macbook) and high speed internet. 
  12. You must be able to start right away! Looking to hire, train and activate this role immediately. 

What We Provide
  1. Call script (flexibility within the script from your end is allowed to come across as human on the phone).
  2. Guide / document of commonly asked questions and answers, plus other important training materials. You will be expected to study/memorize this guide, along with all essential information on our website, in sales/marketing collateral and other materials so you are ready to dispense this information to prospects on the calls at critical times.
  3. Means to send follow up emails to prospects you've spoken with and push them along the sales funnel
  4. Constant support and communications for any questions and problems that arise
  5. Necessary cold calling software + a microphone

Compensation
  1. Weekly base compensation paid every Friday
  2. Opportunity to ramp up, take on more SDR tasks and start earning generous commission and bonuses. To be clear, you need to prove yourself first as a competent and effective cold caller before commission opportunities become available. 

If you've made it this far, please go back and read the post again. Please make sure everything written above fits within who you are, what you're looking for in the next step of your career and is a role you confidently think you can perform very well in. We are interested in serious candidates only, and not people trying to make a quick buck. 

If you do in fact fit all the criteria and requirements, and believe you can make a huge & immediate impact at Surprise HR, please apply right away and we look forward to speaking with you.

At Netlify, we’re building a platform to empower digital designers and developers to build better, more elaborate web projects than ever before. We’re looking for an experienced Software Engineer to work across the Netlify CMS ecosystem, but especially on the core project and first-party extensions. Finally, you’re okay wearing a few hats, and can maintain focus going between writing code, supporting the community, and doing a bit of developer relations.

Our core tools at Netlify are React and Redux with a dash of Webpack and a whiff of Babel, but it’s more important that you have a solid foundation as a web developer and a good sense of architecture and clean code. Frameworks and tools come and go, but the fundamentals stay the same.

Description

Are you looking to earn a consistent income writing high-quality novels in your favorite Romance subgenres and themes?

Then this could well be your next paid writing gig!

 

Job Overview

We are currently looking to expand our fiction team with amazing and experienced romance writers (based in the US or Canada) in all romance subgenres. We are a fast-paced, growing ghostwriting service that can provide you with consistent and exciting projects week after week! Regardless of your romance subgenre preferences, we may have a job for you.

If you are someone that takes pride in their work and is looking to earn a consistent income doing something you enjoy, working from the comfort of your home or office, and doing so alongside an excited and brilliant team, then you may just fit our criteria and land yourself an exciting new gig with us.

 

The Company

As a company, our brand is synonymous with the highest quality writing and great customer experience. Our online reviews are a testament to that. We are thrilled about this and continue to strive for more.

However, our focus is not just on our clients, but also on the team that makes it happen. We love our team and focus on creating an enjoyable working process and keeping their pipelines full with great projects, bringing them a steady income.

In return, our writers ensure that every client that walks through our virtual doors receives an outstanding experience and walks away happy with their product. As a collective, we are always looking to improve and this as allowed our company to grow.

We also focus on helping our writers grow- we do this via a number of development programs we run such as our book club, mastermind groups, editor feedback, writing discussions, and more. This ensures that every writer that passes through HotGhostWriter grows and takes their craft to a higher level. Keep reading if this resonates with you.

 

Pay Rate

Our current rate is $15 USD per 1,000 words. Our projects range from 20k up to 150k words.

Some of our busier writers are earning $2,000+ a month writing a few hours a day around their studies or other gigs. We offer consistent work without having to apply for jobs, work comes to you. Plus, you'll love the team and process!

 

Our Requirements

We are looking for romance writers with at least a good basic skill level and a good understanding of the conventions of the romance subgenre as a whole, and of your preferred romance themes. Here's what's required to be part of our team:

- You write amazing romance stories. With a lot of tension, suspense, great dialogue, and good character development and characterization.
- You are US/CAN based, or US/CAN citizen living outside the country.
- You can work with deadlines. We typically deliver 15k words in 1 week/ week and a half.
- You are knowledgeable in your preferred romance subgenres, themes/tropes. You understand the readers, you understand basic conventions that make a subgenre/theme/etc and you can write to market.
- You take pride in your writing and can consistently deliver high-quality novels. You focus on delivering what the reader and client want.
- You are looking for a long-term gig and are eager & available to start.
- You are available throughout the day to respond to team and client messages on our platform.
- You are reliable, well-spoken, open to constructive criticism and a good communicator.

 

Few things to consider before applying

Important: When applying you will be asked to select up to 3 of your best subgenres. Choose the subgenres you most enjoy and know most about (conventions, typical characters, etc). Please submit a sample for each subgenre you select. If you are successful, we will hire you for 1, 2 or all 3 of your chosen subgenres based on your ability to write and your understanding of each subgenre's conventions. We put a lot of emphasis on this as it's vital to understand what the reader wants.

We will also prioritize you that can commit for at least 3-6 months. items.content:
Talent Manager at Grafana Labs

Remote

REMOTE · United States · G&A

DESCRIPTION

Location: East coast USA preferred/other locations considered

We are looking for a Talent Manager to join our People Ops team to take responsibility for delivering our ambitious global headcount plans. The People Ops mission is to ensure we deliver a highly skilled, committed, successful and happy team and this role will play an integral part in the delivery of that work as we grow. One of our core values is ‘built better together’ and you will apply this to the growth of our team helping to ensure we maintain our strong culture and values as we grow.

This is a fantastic opportunity to help an ambitious tech startup meet our growth plans whilst also getting to work on some really interesting projects. You will take responsibility for the full lifecycle of both technical and non-technical international recruitment. In addition you will have the opportunity to partner with the VP People Ops to contribute to the delivery of projects focussed on recruitment processes, candidate experience, diversity and internal stakeholder recruitment training programs.

If you are an experienced recruiter, ready for a new challenge and enjoy making an impact, we’d love to hear from you!

REQUIREMENTS

  • You will work alongside our Leadership team to deeply understand hiring requirements, hiring challenges, organisational structure and individual team dynamics
  • You will be responsible for the end to end recruitment process covering the entire candidate experience from sourcing and headhunting through to offer stage
  • You will be confident engaging passive candidates and utilising the team’s networks and technical experience to engage with candidates appropriately. You will be tasked with direct sourcing and keeping agency spend to a minimum.
  • You will be required to work with a mix of both technical and commercial international teams
  • You will have experience putting together role specific hiring and sourcing strategies using a broad range of channels including LinkedIn, Stack Overflow, Github, job boards, networking etc
  • You will quickly be able to understand our key requirements and good cultural fit and help to screen candidates based on your strong understanding of what we value and our company culture
  • You will help to champion diversity through our recruitment and work with the VP People Ops to build out a diversity hiring strategy for 2019 and beyond
  • You will work closely with the VP People Ops to review and enhance our recruitment process and to develop and deliver a recruitment best practice training program to the internal team

What would make you a good fit for this role?

We’re a startup so your job duties will be varied and complex and will require strong judgement, collaboration and leadership. Initially this will be a standalone role and you will need to have the experience, drive and energy to hit the ground running working proactively and independently to deliver a first class recruitment service to the business and to candidates.

To be successful in this role you will have experience working in a dynamic, fast-paced global start-up. You will need excellent sourcing/research skills and have an ability to discover candidates for hard to fill requisitions through creative sourcing. It is essential that you have experience recruiting internationally in both Europe and the US.

You will have strong people and communication skills and will be adept at interacting with a variety of people at different levels and from different cultures and backgrounds.

BENEFITS

At our core Grafana Labs is an open company. We believe that open source is the superior way to build and deliver software. We also believe in being open and transparent with our employees. We believe that transparency breeds trust and that trust is the foundation of great teamwork. We actively seek to break down silos, empower employees with information and allow people to “see the whole picture”. This transparency extends to our strategy, our financials, our successes and failures. We empower our team to make their own decisions and trust that they will try to do the right thing.

We are a remote first team. Our three founders are on three different continents and our team of 70+ global employees are based in 15+ different countries. Hiring remotely unlocks the broadest, most diverse, most talented pool of potential employees. It also means that we have built our culture around a flexible and autonomous work environment based on trust.

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, to stay, and to do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organisation and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organisation as we grow.
